properties.areaDesc: Santa Fe Metro Area; Middle Rio Grande Valley/Albuquerque Metro Area; Glorieta Mesa Including Glorieta Pass
properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 11 at 10:24AM MST until February 11 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque NM
properties.description:
...COLDER TEMPERATURES, MODERATE TO HEAVY SNOW, AND WINDY
CONDITIONS THROUGH TONIGHT...

.A potent winter storm will overtake New Mexico through tonight
when many northern and central areas of the state can expect
moderate to heavy snowfall and colder temperatures. In addition,
periods of strong and gusty winds will create areas of blowing
snow in central New Mexico focusing through the middle Rio Grande
Valley from Santa Fe to Albuquerque to Socorro. Residents and
travelers through much of northern and central New Mexico can
expect significant travel impacts through Tuesday night.

* WHAT...Moderate to locally heavy snow and blowing snow
expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 6 inches. Winds
gusting as high as 40 mph around Santa Fe and Glorieta Pass,
and as high as 55 mph below Tijeras Canyon in Albuquerque.

* WHERE...Middle Rio Grande Valley including the Albuquerque
Metro Area, Santa Fe Metro Area, and Glorieta Mesa Including
Glorieta Pass.

* WHEN...Through 11 PM MST tonight.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Lowest snowfall amounts will be below
canyons, while higher amounts are expected around northwest
Rio Rancho, northern portions of Santa Fe, and areas just east
of Glorieta Pass.
properties.instruction:
If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in
your vehicle in case of an emergency.

The latest road conditions for New Mexico can be obtained by
calling 5 1 1, 1-800-432-4269, or visiting nmroads.com.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM MST THIS EVENING
